docs.abstract: Why it's very difficult to separate legal norms from cultural norms.
docs.lead_paragraph: I'm going to try working my way through the many responses to yesterday's column. The process may take a while (i.e. it may be next week before I have a response to Andrew Sullivan's eloquent rebuttal), for which I apologize in advance. But let's begin with Glenn Greenwald, who thinks that I'm wrong to suggest any necessary connection between the establishment of a legal order and the establishment of a cultural ideal. Treating gay unions and straight unions identically in law, he argues, in no way precludes the cultural recognition of the distinctiveness of lifelong heterosexual monogamy:
docs.snippet: Why it's very difficult to separate legal norms from cultural norms.
